title: Add login page with hardcoded credentials

requirements.text: Create a login page component (frontend/src/components/Login.tsx) that renders a centered card with a username field and a password field. On submission, validate that the entered credentials match the hardcoded values (username: 'vsat', password: '0558'). If credentials are correct, mark the session as authenticated (e.g., via React state or sessionStorage) and redirect to the main app. If incorrect, display a clear error message such as 'Invalid username or password'.

quotes: add login page user name - vsat

acceptanceCriteria: A login page is shown when the user is not authenticated, blocking access to the main app.
The login form has a username input and a password input.
Submitting with username 'vsat' and password '0558' authenticates the user and shows the main app.
Submitting with any other credentials displays a visible error message.
After successful login, refreshing the page keeps the user logged in for the session (sessionStorage or equivalent).
A logout button or mechanism is available to return to the login page.

requirements.text: Update the root App.tsx to conditionally render the Login component when the user is not authenticated, and render the full trip management app (Header, Dashboard, TripForm, TripTable, DailyReport, Footer) only when the user is authenticated. Authentication state must be managed at the App level and passed down or stored in sessionStorage so it persists across page refreshes within the same browser session.

quotes: add login page user name - vsat

acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users see only the login page; no trip data or navigation is visible.
Authenticated users see the full app immediately without being redirected to login.
Closing and reopening the browser tab within the same session keeps the user logged in.
Opening a new browser session (new tab after clearing session) requires re-login.

constraints: Credentials must be hardcoded on the frontend (username: 'vsat', password: '0558'). No backend authentication is required.
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
Use sessionStorage (not localStorage) to persist login state so it clears when the browser session ends.
nonGoals: No backend authentication or session management.
No multi-user support or user registration.
No integration with Internet Identity for this login flow.
